definition: bright and beautiful/(of a landscape) gorgeous/(of a color) vibrant
Ming Dynasty (1368-1644)/surname Ming/Ming (c. 2000 BC), fourth of the legendary Flame Emperors, 炎帝[Yan2 di4] descended from Shennong 神農|神农[Shen2 nong2] Farmer God
bright/opposite: dark 暗[an4]/(of meaning) clear/to understand/next/public or open/wise/generic term for a sacrifice to the gods

sentences.english: The ascending flowers are more vibrant in color than ever, and healthier lasting longer than at prior times.
sentences.chinese: 提升的花朵顏色也比往日更明麗，更健康持久。

sentences.english: Lay like the folds of a bright girdle furled.
sentences.chinese: 如同一卷明麗的腰帶伸展。

sentences.english: Do not the bright June roses blow.
sentences.chinese: 明麗的六月你吹拂玫瑰。

sentences.english: In Haizi there is a Five-Color Pond, the brightest lake in Jiuzhaigou.
sentences.chinese: 而其中的五彩池以九寨溝最明麗的海子著稱。

sentences.english: And there the sun burns crimson bright.
Dance to their romance in the sun.

definition: in different poses and with different expressions/in thousands of postures (idiom)
to blend into one another/to blend together well
lucid and elegant/quiet and exquisite/clear and attractive style
living spirit, living image (idiom); true to life/vivid and realistic
